goals.title: Goals
goals.body: I would like to work in an innovative and fast-paced environment with a team contributing to making the world a better place.

items.title: Next9 Adept
items.description: Next9 is a mentorship program. It concists of 9 elected students which each are assigned a mentor. We all meet about once a month and on top of that I meet with my mentor in private once or twice each month. We discuss my goals and my nearby future and what I can improve on to reach all those goals.

items.title: Student Ambassador
items.description: Netlight has a huge demand to hire awesome people. My mission is to help them find driven and competent people that would be a good fit to work at Netlight. This means being aware of what students are looking for in a future employer and how Netlight can be that organization.

items.title: Sole Proprietor
items.description: I have worked with a number of small to medium sized companies. Most of them were non-technical in the sense that they did not have that much knowledge about the web in general. That meant I had to work a lot with acctually explaining which content might work, what a CMS is and such. I also had to work a lot with time plans and explaining what takes time in a development process.

items.title: PBL Group Supervisor
items.description: Problem Based Learning was something new to me when I came to LiU. I really enjoyed it and decided that I wanted to explore how a group like that acctually functions. I learned a lot around group dynamics, how to optimize a group and how no group two groups are equla in terms of what works and what does not.

items.title: Web Developer
items.description: My mission was to figure if, and possibly how, Per&Per could bring their maps to the web. They had a working product on both Android and iOS and wanted to do the same thing in a browser. The end product was a working prototype showing off some of the most requested features.

items.title: Lab Assistant
items.description: An introductory course in web programming. I decided to get involved in this to improve on my pedgogical skill.

items.title: Head of Corporate Relations
items.description: Myself and a group of 5-10 students worked on trying to create opportunities for students and companies to meet.

items.title: Master of Science in Information Technology, Linköping University
items.body: I have really enjoyed my time so far at LiU. I have grown as a person and I feel more condfident in everything I take on in life. I am really interested in software development and therefore I am currently focusing on learning new programming languages, architecture and design principles. Most of the courses I chose for my Masters degree are either entirely focused on code, or something closely related to that.

items.title: Nynäshamns Gymnasium, Science Program
items.body: I was really into math and physics, and that is why I chose science. I studied introductory programming, database design, CAD and lots of math and physics.
